Location checklist:

 

•Approval - DND owned locations must have published Range Standing Orders that will describe how a safe range will operate at that location. Private, commercial or publicly owned locations may need specific approval of the owner/manager before being used as a range.

 

•Minimum space requirements - an air rifle range requires a minimum length of about 15m and about 1.5m width per firing lane (e.g. four lanes will be about 6m wide). An outdoor range will have a danger area template of 250 metres in depth if there is nothing to stop stray pellets behind the target backstops.

 

•Protecting the surroundings - Indoor ranges require a durable wall or barrier behind the target backstops that can withstand damage from stray pellets, as well as barriers or durable walls along the side if there’s not enough space for the danger area template.

 

•Protecting people – participants need a safe place to wait when they’re not shooting, and the danger area must be secured from accidental access by people during shooting (e.g. using barriers, locked doors, signs, and/or sentries, etc.). Remember to ensure access to a hand-washing station or washroom.

Range Location

Basic Range Layout:

 

An air rifle range is shaped like a slice of pie – angling out at 15 from each shooter. The area inside the pie shape is called the danger area template.

 

A PDF version of a standard air rifle range layout  is available in the reference section.
